question: Baby came for immunization for 1st time on 18 months. Which vaccine can be given:
exp: Among given options only DPT Booster & OPV are given to child at 18 months of age in case of Delayed immunization. VACCINES & AGE LIMIT IN DELAYED IMMUNIZATION : Vaccine Age limit BCG, Hep B, Rotavirus, Pentavalent vaccine, fIPV, PCV till 1 yearof age. OPV, Measles, Vitamin A till 5yrs of age HiB till 6 years of age DPT till 7 years of age JE till 15 years of age TT till 16 years of age
opc: Pentavalent, OPV, DPT, Measles and mumps

question: All of the following vaccines are given at 16 - 24 months according to NIS except:-
exp: NIS (National Immunization Schedule, India 2019-20) - At Bih : BCG, OPV0, Hep B - 6 Weeks : DPT1, OPV1, Hep B1, HiB1, Rota V1, fractionated IPV1, PCV1 - 10 Weeks : DPT2, OPV2, Hep B2, HiB2, Rota V2 - 14 Weeks : DPT3, OPV3, Hep B3, HiB3,Rota V3, fractionated IPV2, PCV2 - 9 months : Measles1/MR1, Vitamin A, PCV Booster, live JE1 - Every 6 months : Vitamin A (2 Lacs IU) till 5 years - 16-24 months : DPTB, OPV Booster, Measles2/MR2, live JE2 - 5 Years : DPTB - 10 Years : TT - 16 Years : TT - Pregnancy : TT (In 2020, TT to replaced with Td)

question: All are true about newly introduced Td vaccine in place of TT vaccine except:-
exp: Tetanus Toxoid (TT) vaccine has been replaced with Tetanus and adult diphtheria. (Td) Td vaccine:- Should be given at 5 & 10 years and to Pregnant women replacing TT Vaccine. The use of Td rather TT is recommended during pregnancy to protect against maternal,neonatal tetanus & diphtheria during prenatal care. Td vaccine is a combination of tetanus & diphtheria with lower concentration of diphtheria antigen (d) as recommended for older children and adults. Dose :0.5ml/IM/Upper arm. Shake test is applicable to freeze sensitive vaccines such as DTP, DT, Td, TT, typhoid & hepatitis B. Open l policy is applicable for Td vaccine. Td is freeze & heat sensitive; hence stored at optimal temperature.
opa: First dose should be given at 3 years of age
opd: Open l policy is applicable for Td vaccine

question: A 25 year old man met with an accident 8 hours ago. There is a contaminated wound present on right leg along with right arm fracture. Patient has history of complete tetanus immunization 13 years back. what is the next step?
exp: In above given case, there is a contaminated wound and h/o complete tetanus course is 13 years back(CATEGORY C), so we should give a single dose of tetanus toxoid and Human tetanus immunoglobulin. CATEGORY Clean wound <6H Other wounds A) CC < 5 years nothing nothing B) CC 5-10 years 1 dose TT 1 dose TT C) CC > 10 years 1 dose TT 1 dose TT + TIG D) NOT CC unknown Complete course TT Complete course TT + TIG
opd: Human tetanus immunoglobulin and single dose of toxoid

question: Hepatitis B vaccine in adults should be given as:
exp: Hepatitis B vaccine schedule for adults: 0,1,6 months. (dose: 1 ml each) Hepatitis B vaccine schedule for infants (NIS, India): 6,10,14 weeks or 0,6,14 weeks. (Dose: 0.5 ml each)

question: On examination, a 34 weeks pregnant lady was found to be HBsAg. What is the management for neonate delivered by Hep B + patient?
exp: Hepatitis B vaccine + Immunoglobulin should be given to a neonate born to mother who is HBsAg positive. The simultaneous administration of HBIG and hepatitis B vaccine is more efficacious than HBIG alone. HBIG does not interfere with the antibody response to the hepatitis B vaccine. This combined procedure is ideal both - for prophylaxis of persons accidentally exposed to blood known to contain hepatitis B virus, and - for prevention of the carrier state in the newborn babies of carrier mothers.
opd: Immunoglobulin followed by vaccine 6 month later

question: All are true of BCG vaccine except:-
exp: BCG vaccine is live attenuated vaccine. Only give protection for CNS & disseminated TB. Danish 1331 strain is used. Given by intradermal route of administration. Dose: 0.1ml - left deltoid at Bih.( can give till one year ) Only 1dose of BCG is recommended under NIS.

question: Rota virus vaccine schedule can be given till the age of :
exp: Routine rotavirus vaccination recommended for all infants begins at 6 weeks of age , followed by 1 dose each in 10th & 14 weeks of age. Rotavirus vaccine can be given up till 1 year age in National immunization

question: Vitamin A should be staed at the age of :-
exp: - Accordong to NIS Vit A should be staed at the age of 9 months & from then, should be given for every 6 months till 5yrs of age. - Hence, totally 9 doses of Vit A is given; i.e 17 lakh IU.

question: BCG should be given :-
exp: BCG is a live vaccine, should be given Immediately after bih. BCG vaccine if not given at bih : Give along with first dose of DPT vaccine (6 weeks). Age limit for BCG vaccine under NIS : Till 1 year age.

question: According to the latest guidelines of vaccination, which of the following is applicable at the age of 5 years :-
exp: According to Latest National immunization Schedule - NIS 2020-21: - Total 3 doses of DPT vaccine each at 6,10 & 14 weeks; & 2 booster doses each at & 5yrs of age are given respectively. - Vitamin A should be staed at 9months of age & given for every 6months till 5yrs of age. - Hence DPT booster & Vit A are applicable at the age of 5 yrs. - 5 doses of OPV is completed with in 16-24months of age normally ; only in delayed immunization, it can be given till 5yrs of age. - Other recent changes in immunization guidelines in India: - 2 doses of Measles vaccine:- first dose: 9 months of age. second dose: 16-24 months age. - 2 doses of JE Live vaccine: First dose : 9-12 months. Second dose =16-24 months.

question: The strain used in Mumps vaccine is
exp: The various strains used for Mumps include Jeryl-Lynn, RIT-4385, Leningrad-3, L-Zagreb and Urabe strains.

question: All are true about Hepatitis B vaccine except
exp: Hepatitis B is recombinant protein vaccine, not polysaccharide based vaccine. Other recombinant protein Vaccines - Anti HPV vaccine, Lyme disease vaccine, Cholera toxin B vaccine Remaining all other options about Hep-B vaccine are true EXTRA EDGE: Polysaccharide based vaccines are: Typhim-Vi Pneumococcal vaccine Meningococcal vaccine Hib vaccine
opa: Made by inseing the segment of hepatitis B virus gene into a yeast cell
opc: Hepatitis B Vaccine is identical to natural hepatitis B surface antigen, but does not contain virus DNA
opd: Vaccine should be given at Anterolateral side of left mid-thigh
